title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 350.1 - Agreements for contingent payments prohibited
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 350.1 - Agreements for contingent payments prohibited

State Regulations

Any agreement, whether written or oral, express or implied, for the payment of any money, compensation or thing of value as a fee for
professional or other services rendered, as a brokerage commission, or as a
"finder's" fee, or as any other kind of payment, which is dependent upon or
contingent upon the approval of, or the making of, a loan by the authority, is
hereby prohibited. At or prior to the closing of every loan the authority shall
require proof of the absence of any violation of this rule. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 21

350.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
